instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rail PGOOD
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with moisture damage. Light, no fan. Board worked on previously - SMC reworked. No history on this repair. Believe this damage came after previous repair. 

S0 Rail PGOOD - <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> area corrosion. Pad for pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R8156</RESISTOR> burnt away. Removed and cleaned up. Plugged board in to watch for short.. surprised by fan cycling as usual then came on.
Replaced <RESISTOR>R8156</RESISTOR> and ran jumper to near <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> (tested at 3.34v). Back to no power. Removed jumper all works. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>, same results. 
<TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> provides <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> but <RESISTOR>R8156</RESISTOR> appears to be the only non S0 supply... Does this mean it’s sensing an issue with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> which I’m bypassing or S0 somewhere else? Or Is this an issue after, with the SMC or two other inputs from <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

Checked area for shorts compared to good board. 
Known good I/O board and cable. 
Power supply and good Magsafe. 

Machine boots, loads to recovery mode, charges battery and runs ASD all fine. Only issue found is with a CPU thermal sensor (related?). 

Can I run without <RESISTOR>R8156</RESISTOR> even though it supplies to a ‘critical’ component?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rail PGOOD
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8151</RESISTOR> pad 1 was corroded. Missed this. 

Only issue on ASD is TCon verification test 12016 Error. Anyone know what this is? Has to do with the display tests. Mac appears to function fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rail PGOOD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 Rail PGOOD
threads.message: Tcon test is an LCD issue and could be because it has some Chinese LCD on it. Ignore if machine works otherwise.
